title: FOI for Food Safety Data - 7 Spices Balti

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
I am writing to submit a Freedom of Information request regarding health information for a business situated in Sheffield.
Specifically, I would like to see:
• Reports relating to food safety inspections/food hygiene ratings,
• Any relevant correspondence or emails around the above,
• Please supply the information regarding the most recent inspection and any reports/documentation relating to other inspections, violations, complaints, etc. during the five previous years.
The business I am enquiring about is:
7 Spices Balti (sometimes stylised as Seven Spices Balti)
Mayfair Court
120 West Bar
Sheffield
S3 8PP
Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your response within 20 working days.
Yours faithfully,
M Cocker

Dear M Cocker,
Thank you for your request for information relating to 7 Spices Balti
which we received on 23/08/2024.
As your request is a request for information relating to the environment,
this has been logged as a request under the Environmental Information
Regulations 2004 (EIR) and will be dealt with under the Regulations. The
reference number for your request can be found above.
The Environmental Information Regulations 2004 state that we must respond
to you within 20 working days, by 23/09/2024. Please do not hesitate to
contact us at the email address below if you have any queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
Email: [1][Sheffield City Council request email]
From: M Cocker <[FOI #1166149 email]>
Sent: Friday, August 23, 2024 5:13 PM
To: FOI <[Sheffield City Council request email]>
Subject: Freedom of Information request - FOI for Food Safety Data - 7
Spices Balti
[You don't often get email from [2][FOI #1166149 email]. Learn why this is

Dear Sheffield City Council FOI Team,
I hope this message finds you well.
I am writing to follow up on my Freedom of Information request relating to 7 Spices Balti / Seven Spices Balti, submitted on 23rd August 2024. According to the Freedom of Information Act 2000, you are required to respond to such requests within 20 working days. Unfortunately, this deadline has now passed, and I have yet to receive your response.
I would appreciate it if you could provide an update and ensure that I receive a full response by 17:00 on Wednesday 25th September. Should I not hear from you within this time frame, I will be left with no choice but to refer the matter to the Information Commissioner's Office (ICO) for further investigation.
Thank you for your attention to this, and I look forward to hearing from you as soon as possible.
Kind regards,
M Cocker

Dear M Cocker
Thank you for your email of 24 September 2024.
We apologise for missing the legal deadline of 23 September 2024.
Our response is still being processed and will be with you, not by 5pm,
but before midnight.
Thank you for your patience.
Kind regards
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
Email: [1][Sheffield City Council request email]
This Email, and any attachments, may contain non-public information and is
intended solely for the individual(s) to whom it is addressed. It may
contain sensitive or protectively marked material and should be handled
accordingly. If this Email has been misdirected, please notify the author
immediately. If you are not the intended recipient you must not disclose,
distribute, copy, print or rely on any of the information contained in it
or attached, and all copies must be deleted immediately. Whilst we take
reasonable steps to try to identify any software viruses, any attachments
to this Email may nevertheless contain viruses which our anti-virus
software has failed to identify. You should therefore carry out your own
anti-virus checks before opening any documents. Sheffield City Council
will not accept any liability for damage caused by computer viruses
emanating from any attachment or other document supplied with this e-mail

Dear M Cocker,
Thank you for your request for information relating to 7 Spices Balti
which we received on 23/08/2024. We apologise for the delay in providing
this response.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
The premises came under new ownership on 15/11/2023 and is currently
‘Awaiting Inspection’.
Visits:-
02/11/2022 – Food Hygiene Inspection
• Email (attached) named laser thermometer example
• Email (attached) named Food Hygiene training
• 7 Spices Initial Visit Date 02-11-2022 Food Hygiene & Food Rating
Report
16/01/2022 – Paid Re-rating Inspection Email (attached) named RE: laser
thermometer example
• 7 Spices Balti Paid Re-Rating Visit 16-01-2023 Food Hygiene & Rating
Report
Complaints:-
27/12/2023 - Complaint re chicken not fresh and not hot when services
other concerns
• Microsoft word report attached 7 Spices Balti Complaint 27-12-2023 –
Letter to 7 Spices Balti 02-01-2024
24/08/2023 - Notification of Power cut off – no correspondence
Please note, the names of third parties and the names of some staff
members have been redacted under Regulation 12(3) of the Environmental
Information Regulations 2004 (EIR) and Regulation 13 EIR as amended by
Sch. 19, para 307 of the Data Protection Act 2018, which provide an
exception for where the information requested includes personal data of
which the applicant is not the data subject where disclosure would
contravene the data protection principles of the General Data Protection
Regulation (GDPR). Disclosure of the information would contravene the data
protection principle under Article 5(1)(a) of the General Data Protection
Regulation that processing of personal data must be fair, lawful and
transparent.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [1]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[2]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
